titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Alan Levitt Papers PASC.0090
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Performing Arts Library Special Collections staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Julie Graham and Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-01 16:41:18 -0700.

did.abstract: Alan J. Levitt was a television writer. The collection consists primarily of scripts and production material for productions such as Three's Company (1977-1978) and Maude (1972-1973), among others.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
RESTRICTED ACCESS: Use of audio material requires production of listening copies.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIO MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed audio materials. Audio materials are not currently available for access, unless otherwise noted in a Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the series and file levels. All requests to access processed digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alan J. Levitt Papers (Collection PASC 90). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.
Processed by UCLA Performing Arts Library Special Collections staff.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: There is very little information available about Alan J. Levitt. Levitt was a television writer whose credits include Julia, Maude, and Three's Company, among others. His work on All in the Family garnered him an Emmy Award nomination for Outstanding Writing Achievement in Comedy, in 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of materials related to television writer Alan J. Levitt. Inlcudes outlines, script drafts and revisions, treatments, and production information, ephemera, and audio cassettes of interviews. Among the projects represented in the collection are Julia , Maude , and Three's Company , among others.

did.unittitle: Cassettes (21 items): All In The Family, Maude, Sanford, and others.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Audio cassettes in this collection are restricted and require the creation of listening copies.

controlaccess.occupation: Television writers -- California -- Los Angeles -- Archives.
